definition: important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: I'm sorry to be so short-tempered but I have an awful headache.
sentences.chinese: 我很抱歉脾氣這麼壞，所有是我頭疼得要命。

sentences.english: I'm steaming mad at him because he always enters into rivalry with me.
sentences.chinese: 他總是和我唱對臺戲，氣得我要命。

sentences.english: The water was blessedly deep and we went down like stones.
sentences.chinese: 水深得要命，我和樹熊象石頭一樣沉到底。

sentences.english: I"m not a bit hungry but not a little thirsty ."
sentences.chinese: 我一點也不餓，可就是渴得要命。

sentences.english: The young people next door had a wild and woolly party last night!
sentences.chinese: 隔壁的年輕人昨晚舉行聚會，吵得要命。

sentences.english: Why, I'm that tired Sunday I can't even read the papers.
sentences.chinese: 唉，星期天我可是疲倦得要命，連報都懶得看的。

sentences.english: Moreover, tourists often come and have picnics here, because of its beauty.
sentences.chinese: 要命的是，遊客們慕名而來，經常燒烤野炊。

sentences.english: These cups are pretty, but they are deadly dear.
sentences.chinese: 這些杯子真美，可是實在貴得要命。

sentences.english: But you can make very simple demonstration that this is really true.
sentences.chinese: 做一個這樣的演示可真得是簡單得要命。

sentences.english: " The young man raged: "Dare you! Tell me, who wants me to be his grandson?
sentences.chinese: 你說，是誰不要命了，膽敢要老子做他的孫子？

sentences.english: We were freezing, and I put my arm around her.
sentences.chinese: 我們都凍得要命，我用手摟着她。

sentences.english: James is scared to death of flying.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯怕坐飛機怕得要命。

sentences.english: I put my hand on metal railings and snatch it away, burnt.
sentences.chinese: 我剛把手搭到金屬欄杆上立刻便縮了回來，燙得要命。

sentences.english: On the other hand, he's a wildly fun person to be around.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，他在身邊又是一個有趣得要命的人。

sentences.english: The rush hour traffic is murder.
sentences.chinese: 尖端時間的交通真要命。

sentences.english: I had a hell of a time drawing him out to do battle.
sentences.chinese: 我花了長得要命的時間才把他引出來戰。

definition: to feel unwell/to suffer pain/to be difficult to bear
to have bad luck/to be out of luck

(indicates that sth turns out just the opposite of what one would wish) unfortunately/as it happened/(indicates that sth is the opposite of what would be normal or reasonable) stubbornly/contrarily/against reason/(indicates that sb or a group is singled out) precisely/only/of all people
ruthless/fierce/ferocious/determined/to harden (one's heart)/old variant of 很[hen3]
to blow one's top/to be driven mad/to become frantic
see 他媽的|他妈的[ta1 ma1 de5]
